---
pagetitle: CSS Specificity - Position
example:
  title: CSS Specificity - Position
  instructions: Create two rules again. Give `.parent` a `red` color and then create
    a second `.parent` rule, but this time with a blue `color`. What color will the
    `.parent` text be?
  runtime: repl
  mode:
    document: html
  initial:
    js: ~
    css: |-
      .parent {
      }
  solution:
    js: ~
    css: |-
      .parent {
        color: red;
      }

      .parent {
        color: blue;
      }
      
      /* the text is blue because 
         the 2nd definition occurs last */
output: js4shiny::html_document_js4shiny

---
<div><!--for pandoc-->
<div class="parent">
  <h2>Header 2</h2>
  <p>paragraph text...</p>
</div>
</div><!--for pandoc-->
